Pledgie Donations

This is the personal homepage of Elad Meidar, a web developer and an entrepreneur specializing in Ruby on Rails. I am a proud member of RailsBridge, Helping new Rails developers get into our world and also contributed a few Patches to the Ruby on Rails core.

I hang around Fort Lauderdale, FL and Tel-Aviv in Israel, and i am currently running Nautilus6 so Feel free to contact me regarding projects :).

Bag O' Links - 3/11/2009 /
name age history
Bag O' Links - 3/11/2009 04/11/2009 Another post [Elad Meidar]
  • First look at Rails 3.0.pre – Dr Nic’s first attempt on the upcoming Rails 3 pre release.
  • Rails practices slide – this one has actually more than 2 good ideas inside.
  • drier gem configs – @hakunin is doing it again, now a better more readable way to specify your config.gem.
  • Easily create a javascript framework – obviously a lie, thu worth the read.
  • Javascript minifying tools – a quick set of tools for reference.
  • Know when to fold’em – one way to handle too many open source projects.
  • git-wtf – a script to display the state of your repository in a readable and easy-to-scan format.
  • using the new gem bundler – this will be an integrated part into Rails 3, better start now.
  • method aliasing in Ruby – and why chaining is potentially evil.
  • web design with pixelmator – meh, but i like pixel mator.
  • simple_importer tutorial – how to import csv into your Rails app.
  • w3c gets a new home – navigation totally changed, not sure if it’s right or not.
  • Using MongoMapper – a brief tutorial on how to use this MongoDB OM gem.

Treasures

  • spork – A DRb server for testing frameworks (RSpec / Cucumber currently) that forks before each run to ensure a clean testing state.
  • resque – A simple Redis-based queue.
  • autoMySQLBackup – A script to take daily, weekly and monthly backups of your MySQL databases using mysqldump.
  • trap_door – lure those spam bots into oblivion.
  • fluid_grid_system – A lightwieght XHTML/CSS framework that follows both the typographic grid, and also baseline grid
  • faketwitter – a fakeweb extension to fake twitter responses.
